title: Great walk around
text: Very nice place to work around and visit all the stores and find bargains. Just make sure you keep a close eye on your belongings, as it is well known for professional pickpockets.

title: A piece of history
text: What an amazing part of history! I suggest really researching it before visiting to really appreciate it, otherwise you can always follow a tour guide. It is quite a walk up, so be prepared and wear comfortable shoes and take plenty of water. It makes a big difference if you go off season or early enough to beat the crowds.

title: Wow wow wow
text: This is absolutely an amazing place! Check in is very easy and quick, staff very friendly and the apartment is clean and spacious. The location is unbelievable!!!! I highly recommend this apartment! One downside though is that the rooms facing the street get noisy, but otherwise a 5 star apartment. You get an amazing view from your dining table and when you take the lift down, it opens up in a Starbucks! What a wonderful find, don’t think twice.

title: Very nice museum
text: Very nice museum with very interesting artifacts. Photos are not allowed u fortunately. It is quite big and a nice cool getaway on a hot day.

title: Fun day out
text: It was quite a fun day out although a bit expensive. It is far from town, so finding a taxi for the way back will be difficult, I agreed on a set price with my very friendly taxi driver and he waited for us to finish.

title: Great piece of history
text: This is an amazing part of history in general and the only pics in particular. Make sure you go inside their little museum with all the Olympic torches.

title: Needs a major update
text:
Let’s start with the good:
-The lobby is magnificent, the hotel grounds are amazing and the check in was quick.
-After check in you go to a separate desk to place your breakfast order, you get a choice of oriental, American or kids breakfast which is delivered to your room in 1 hour increments from 6am-11am. The prestige suite was huge. You get a bedroom separate living room and 1.5 bathrooms.
-On the ground floor you get a big terrace that takes you straight into the garden, pool (closed due to Covid-19), and the beach.
-The shower had excellent and consistent pressure and temperature control.
-The breakfast quantity was HUGE! We opted for the oriental and 1 was enough for 2 people.
-The staff were all extremely friendly and professional.
Now unfortunately for the bad:
-The room was filthy, the “minibar” had pieces of food and the room corners were mouldy. When we complained though it was dealt with very professionally, the housekeeping manager came to inspect, ordered a recreating and sanitised the whole room and offered us complimentary stuff.
-The overall look of the room was tired and needed an update.
-The AC temperature control wasn’t very good or consistent and was quite outdated.
-It also was very surprising to see a luxurious 5 star hotel with old TVs that were not smart and had limited channels, with no access to things like Netflix or YouTube.
-The most disappointing and mind boggling thing was the “minibar”, which does not work in any room in the hotel (as advised),I was told that it just keeps things at room temperature (basically a cupboard with a light) and they provide an ice bucket if requested, very surprising and annoying on a hot summer day planned to be spent on the beach (only thing open during Covid-19).
Overall good 3 star hotel, decent 4 star hotel, but poor luxurious 5 star hotel with great friendly staff. What should separate this hotel from others is the attention to detail, but the lack of made me rate it poorly.
Finally I have to give a notable mention to Mr. Syed Fasiullah the housekeeping manager, he always went above and beyond for us, and made any of our complaints disappear and turned our frowns into smiles.
place: Sofitel Bahrain Zallaq Thalassa Sea & Spa

title: Great food and service
text: One of the best in Bahrain! The good is fantastic! Breakfast, lunch and dinner is all good. And they have the best cakes in Bahrain, so leave room for desserts.

title: Best in Bahrain
text: This is probably THE best restaurant in Bahrain! Almost anything you order will be amazing and the price is very reasonable! The cocoa salad, lahina, Swahili, chili chicken, and peach ice tea are some of my favorites. The service isn’t that good though, and the waiters are usually not friendly and that’s the only reason it doesn’t get 5 stars. It is small and gets very very busy, so expect to wait 45 mins for a table, unless you go at off peak times.

title: Best in the Lagoon
text: One of the best when in the lagoon. Your choices in the lagoon are limited if you want something decent but this is one of the few good places. They have nice sandwiches and a wide selection of tea and other beverages.

title: Decent lunch
text: Decent stop for lunch, the food and service were good but not extraordinary. I’m not sure about the very high rating on TA though.

title: A must
text: A must when in Milan. Very beautiful, and I would suggest getting the audio guide. A lot of steps if you decide to go all the way up, we paid for the elevator option though.

title: Interesting mall
text: A very interesting mall. High end stores but it is kinda small but worth a few minutes of your day after or before visiting the duomo. It is a very beautiful building.

title: Nice place
text: Nice place for a quick pizza stop. The atmosphere is great and the service is excellent. The pizza is alright and I would suggest stopping by if you are in the area. It was about a 3 minute walk from where I was staying, so we ate here twice.

title: Beautiful castle
text: A beautiful castle to spend a few hours out of the day checking out museums. It is full of different museums and exhibits. We particular enjoyed Leonardo and Michelangiolo’s exhibits.

title: A quick break
text: Just nice for a quick break. Sit by the garden and people watch for a few minutes. The fountain itself is nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Very good
text: Very good Pomet if that’s what you are looking for. Limited menu but great service and the decor is very interesting and quirky. I recommend it if you are in the area and in the mood for a Pomet. The best one is probably the classic but it all comes down to personal taste.

title: Just amazing!
text: Absolutely amazing gelato!! An absolute must when in bellagio! I highly recommend the pistachio and the nocciola (hazelnut) gelato.

title: Average for Italy
text: We tried to have dinner here without a reservation but were turned down. We came back the next night with a reservation but were not impressed. I think it might have been our mistake for coming here looking for good pasta meal, instead of meat dishes as it seems this is what this place is known for. The service was really good but the meal was average for Italy.

title: The best meal in Italy!
text: By far the best meal we’ve had in Italy! We’ve tried many more restaurants with higher ratings on TA but this was by far the best! We stumbled across this place after being turned down by the 2 restaurants that we actually wanted to eat at but didn’t have a reservation on a busy Friday night, it was also full here but the manager managed to get us a table after a short wait. The lasagna and eggplant Parmesan were absolutely amazing, the tiramisu was also great and the cheesecake might have been the best I have ever eaten (and this is coming from a real cheesecake fan). We came back again for lunch the next day!

title: A must when in rome
text: Quite majestic! I would recommend booking a tour online well in advance, otherwise you could spend the whole day waiting in line. Don’t be fooled by the dozens of “guides” outside offering skip the line tours and guiding you to the wrong lines and miss informing tourists.

title: Good place for lunch
text: This is a decent place for a lunch stop when visiting the colosseum. The good thing about coming out is that they are open through out the day (most place take a break after 14:00-14:30). The food was alright and the service was great! Very friendly staff. I would recommend it if you are in the area, especially if you are looking for a late lunch.

title: Very good experience
text: We popped in for lunch and were not disappointed! The food was delicious and the smoothies are an absolute must! If we had more time we would have come back.

title: Good walk
text: A nice afternoon visit. We just walked around and enjoyed our ice creams. Grab a seat an enjoy the weather and the people watching. It’s in a very convenient location, so you don’t have to go out of your way to get to it, otherwise it wouldn’t be worth it.

title: A tick in the box
text: It’s one of those things that you have to say you have seen while in Paris. It is a marvel when you take into account when and how it was built.

title: Absolutely amazing
text: This is THE best place to have a meal in Disney! The atmosphere, the service and the food were all really good. The steak is a must!

title: Two thumbs up
text: Really good place for a cup of tea/cold drink and a dessert. The Mille-feuille is a must, but almost everything is good.

title: Conveniently located garden
text: Real nice garden with a few snack stalls as I recall, the ice cream one is by far the most popular one, especially in the summer. The good thing about it is it’s location, it’s not worth going out of your way to come here though.

title: Very interesting
text: Requires lots of time and planning, you should know what you want to see and where it is located before visiting. Some of the staff can be very very rude, while others can be quite nice.

title: Good for pictures
text: It is located right at the start of the champs elysees. I haven’t been all the way up. But it’s a good place to take pictures.

title: Just ok
text: The theme is real interesting and worth a visit but the food is just ok. There are better food options in the area.

title: Good and convenient
text: Really good shopping area in a very convenient location if you are staying close to Disney. It has everything you need.

title: Depends
text: It really depends if you are really into this kind of thing or not. I wasn’t personally impressed as I am not really into art and the paintings seemed to be the main attraction. The garden and “water fountain show” weren’t worth the fuss.

title: Excellent food and service
text: This was the place that we frequented the most while in Bali, we probably had around 9 different items from the menu and they were all good! Gets kind of busy at peak times and the wait may be long for your meals, but you will be warned before you are seated if this is to be expected. It took us a while to find the restaurant as almost no one knew of it, I am guessing because the name on the sign in the restaurant isn’t verdant organic kitchen, anyway it is in block C of Bali collection, just after the play area.

title: Great beaxh
text: This is one of the best beaches in Bali as some of the others can collect trash after the rains. Clean beach and good for swimming during high tide, not worth it in low tide.

title: Best option if you are staying in Nusa Dua
text: It isn’t great but it is the best option if you are in one of the resorts in Nusa Dua. It had a supermarket, food options and other outlets. Expect to pay above market price for everything though. Still it’s a short walk or a quick ride on the hotel shuttle, so it is quite convenient if you don’t feel like a long commute (traffic) or eating in the hotel.

title: Nice place to visit while in kuta
text: Nice open air shopping mall, has plenty of outlets. Seems to have whatever you are looking for and it is very conveniently located. It also also a nice place to cool off. You can have some ice cream or Starbucks and relax.

title: Haggle haggle haggle
text: Nice street to buy some souvenirs and gift but haggling is a must! Plenty of eateries as well and a short walk to beach walk shopping mall.

title: Great food
text: Amazing food and ok service. The atmosphere is ok as well, don’t expect too much, but the food is really worth it. The tuna and the mei gorang were out of this world.

title: Really good and interesting
text: It is a must when in Bali but can be a little unsettling to be surrounded by all these monkeys. They sometimes jump on you and can snatch things from you, but if you follow the rules you should be fine. Don’t take in any food with you.

title: Great atmosphere
text: The atmosphere was really nice and interesting. If you are uncomfortable sitting on the floor, try to get a bale that has a space under the table to dangle your legs. Food was really good but don’t expect much attention from the servers.

title: Nice spot
text: Great view and nice spot for pictures. Not much else to do. At low tide you can practically walk up to the temple. Get lots of souvenirs as you are leaving, much better price than Legian street.

title: Amazing
text: Such an amazing experience to have lunch in a tree house. The snapper was quite good and the kids burgers (no bread) was just ok. Also if you are uneasy with squirrels right next to you then this place might not be for you.

title: Not bad
text:
Not bad at all but don't expect too much. The food was decent and the atmosphere was alright, no air conditions but that wasn't an issue, especially since it was raining.
The squid pepper roast is highly recommended, the other dishes were just alright. They only had 3 out of maybe 10 desserts that were on the menu, we took the fried banana, it wasn't that great.
The sweet lime soda was good but the syrup was too thick, you should ask for a lighter one.

title: One of the best!
text: Amazing zoo, very well laid out. Unfortunately it was a bit chilly and rainy so we didn't get to see some animals. The biggest disappointment was not seeing the hippos. But all the other animals were amazing and looked well taken care of with enough space in their enclosures. The zoo restaurant was alright as well, good enough to keep you going for a couple more hours in the zoo. It would have been nice if the aquarium was bigger though. All in all a very good few hours spent with the young one here, wouldn't mind going back.

title: Very good and highly recommended
text:
Came here for dinner after a recommendation from my concierge and I was not disappointed.
The multi lingual staff are very friendly and helpful, the price is quite reasonable and the food is quite tasty.
I would highly recommend the shish Tawooq, very tender chicken pieces.
The only disappointment is that they didn't have good vegetarian dishes or any fish dishes on the menu, but will definitely be back today and will just ask the waiter for something vegetarian.
High chairs are provided for children.
A meal for 2 adults and 1 child cost about 100 TL.

title: Close to excellence
text:
Just had lunch here today after a long anticipation.
Been wanting to visit for a while but never had he chance head down to Saar.
The food is unbelievable and the portions were gigantic, I've seen some reviewers complaining about the size of the portions, I guess it depends on what you are having, I highly recommend the Sayadiya (baby Hamour with rice).
The staff were extremely friendly, helpful and professional. The chef/owner came and made a few rounds, checking and overtone and making a few recommendations.
We had 1 starter which wasn't that's good, 2 excellent Mains, 3 drinks and shared a dessert, total bill was about 50BD, which is much higher than what you would pay in other places, but you must remember that here they serve good fresh Organic food, which you don't get in other places.
So yes more expensive but in my option worth it, will definitely come back.

title: Good, could be much better
text:
The hotel grounds are very beautiful, but the hotel itself looks old and in need for an update.
The worst part is that on the day I stayed the hotel didn't have hot water for 8 hours, and when we finally got hot water, it was yellow and rusty.
Room service was quite good, breakfast buffet was good as well, as long as you don't go as soon as they start, they need more time to finish setting up usually.

title: Very good but seems like the standard is going down
text:
I've been here many times. the hotel is average but the rooms were excellent and the service was unbeatable, but ever since they changed their name from the Sheraton to the Crowne Plaza it seems that the standard has gone down.
The rooms are not kept at a proper temperature before checking in, which makes it a bit humid and intern give the bed a wet feeling.
The sheets and towels are not as fluffy and fresh as they used to be, it now lacks that nice crisp fresh feel and smell that you usually get in good hotels.
I hope they go back to their previous standard.

title: One of the best
text:
This is a real experience, one of the best restaurants I've been to, and THE best restaurant I've been to in India.
The atmosphere is just amazing and the food is excellent.
Highly recommended restaurant when in town.
The soft shell crab starter is unbelievable and should not be missed.
The sitting area outside is beautiful, especially in good weather, but the tables can accommodate more than 4-5 guests maximum.

title: Major service improvement
text:
The food is still amazing as always and I am glad to say that that hasn't changed, and I'm glad to say that the service has improved as well.
The last couple of times I was there I got nice and friendly service, none of the rude treatment that I was accustomed to receiving in Harput.
I am happy with the improvements, and hope they keep it up.

title: Once and never again
text: The food was honestly one of the worst Italian I have had in Bahrain, decided to try it out once and never went back, there are many better options right next to it.

title: Good
text:
In my opinion it deserves 3.5 stars, it is just good but unfortunately there are not many options for hotdogs and this seems to be one of the more decent places.
You won't be disappointed but you won't be blown away either.

title: Close but not quite
text:
I think anyone who calls it a true New York pizza hasn't eaten pizza in New York.
The pizza is quite good, and maybe as close to a New Yorker as you could get in Bahrain but it is not quite there, pretty good pie never the less.

title: Average Hotel+Excellent Staff= very good rating
text:
I think the title explains it all, stayed in the panorama suite, which is like 2 connecting rooms with one turned into a living room.
Stayed in the hotel for just 1 night so didn't manage to check out all the features.
The hotel looks really dull from outside and the inside isn't much better.
The rooms looked really tired and old and in need of a major upgrade.
The bathrooms and sheets and towels did not smell nice and clean as you would expect in a hotel like the intercontinental.
The area where I thought they excelled was the customer service, the staff were all very nice and helpful at all times.
I used the hotel parking and found it to be cheaper than other places in Frankfurt.
All in all a good hotel for a one nighter but there are better options out there.
This time a stayed here because of necessity as there was a convention in town and my usual hotel was full, doubt I will come back here unless faced with a similar situation, not because the hotel was particularly bad but because I prefer the other options out there.

title: Very close to excellence
text:
This is a great hotel and could easily become excellent. We arrived the hotel in the late afternoon, parked my car up front and handed my keys to the concierge as is the procedure if no one will remain in the car.
The check-in was quick and the staff were friendly and they were expecting me.
We stayed in the king junior suite, and it was pretty much flawless, we even got a complimentary fruit and chocolate tray and a bottle of water.
The suite was quite spacious and the living room was separated from the bedroom with two sliding doors.
With the suite we got access to the executive lounge, but we didn’t really take advantage of it.
The breakfast was excellent and the staff were really friendly and attentive, even though they were quite short of staff when we were there, but we didn’t feel it at all, the bakery at breakfast was amazing.
The hotel location is very good as well, a couple of minutes walk from Frankfurt’s largest shopping street, but remember all the stores are closed in Germany on Sundays by law.
This is without a question the best hotel we stayed in during our eurotrip, but unfortunately its not perfect.
The sad thing is that the hotel’s flaws can very easily be rectified if they wished to do so.
For starters the parking price for hotel guests is ridiculous. I think it was something like 30 euros a day, but luckily it was a Friday evening, and there are some free spots on the weekend right in front of the hotel, not many but not impossible to find one.
Secondly this was the first hotel I ever stayed in that did not provide complimentary water every day for its guests.
And lastly the worst and silliest part of this hotel is the unbelievable price they put on wifi, didn’t know there were good hotels that still charged for wifi.

Other than these sadly easily and cheaply rectifiable cons, this is an excellent hotel.

title: A typical European hotel, and not in a good way
text:
Average hotel at best, especially for the price we paid, it had some good pros but unfortunately some disappointing cons as well.

Firstly we checked in the hotel at 4pm, the check in process was quick and the staff were friendly, we took our suitcases up ourselves as there was no one there to help, but they do provide you with a trolly.

When we got to the room (we took a superior suite) it was a complete mess, someone had checked out and the room was not cleaned, food trays in the rooms, towels on the floor, and beds were used, we called the reception and they gave us an insincere apology and changed our room.

The new room was spotless, very clean and comfortable, the superior suite has a separate living room that can be closed off from the bedroom by two large doors, the bathroom can be accessed from either the living room or bedroom as it has doors at either side, in the bathroom you have two sinks and a heated towel rack that heats up the whole bathroom which was very nice, as well you have a separate little room for the toilet with a door and on the other side you have the shower with its own door as well.
The bed was pretty comfortable but it is actually to separate mattresses that are put together (so you cant really sleep in the middle) and you get two quilts.
Also the room was about 160 steps away from the elevator, which was inconvenient especially while dragging suitcases and carrying a baby, there is a closer elevator but it doesn't take you down to the lobby (clear design flaw).

You also get a little patio which was nice, also the room wasn't particularly quiet nor noisy.
Free wifi is available but it is practically useless, so ended up using my phones data, you can get a local chip for about 15 euros, just make sure you get something other than O2, as it is as useless as the hotels wifi.

The breakfast buffet was quite good, everything was clearly labelled in German, English and Arabic, I had ordered the same omelet on 3 different days, and each day I got a different omelet and none of the days was it what I had ordered.
They also have a coffee and hot water (for tea) machine, so you pretty much serve yourself.

The hotel location is pretty good, nothing is too far away, they even have a small supermarket attached to the hotel.

The parking price is absolutely ridiculous! I asked the receptionist if they had any free parking around the hotel and he told me that I would have to just look for one on the street, but later on another receptionist advised me of a free parking lot right next to the hotel and I am very grateful to her.

We Also once asked room service to bring us an empty plate and they advised us that it would cost us 4 euros, or we could just go down and collect it from the bar ourselves for free.

The hotel is clearly a business hotel, as there were many people in business suits in the lobby at most times of the day, conferences and also would occasionally have meetings at the breakfast buffet.

Directions to the free parking lot: Once you exit the hotel walk to the road, at the road turn left and walk for about a minute, you will find the parking lot on your right.
The parking lot is free and safe but still use your common sense and don't leave your valuables clearly visible in your car.
They also sometimes block a few parkings in the parking lot, but all the other parkings are free for use.

title: Easter brunch
text:
The Easter brunch was simply amazing, they officially start brunches on the 10th of April, but they had an earlier brunch specifically for Easter, and it is one of the best buffets I have had in Bahrain, with many different stations.
The Sushi/seafood station was amazing, they also had a great Indian station with fresh tandoori done right in front of you, a homemade pasta station made to order, a grill station as well made to order, a middle eastern station with fresh shawarmas made to order, a Chinese/Asian station, and amazing dessert station (always remember to keep room) and much more.
We will definitely be regulars here, plus the service was really really good.
The only flaw I found was the parking area, the entrances were not clearly marked and so you are not quite sure where to park your car.
I don't give 5 stars very often but this deserved it, enjoy.

title: Good but not "Magnifique"
text:
First things first,the hotel staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful, and the hotel was always nice and clean.
We stayed in the Opera suite during our stay in Sofitel.
The suite was nice, you get a separate living room with a half bathroom, a patio and a direct access to the pool.
In the sitting room you get a small table with 2 chairs and a sofa (I'm sure it has another name other than sofa) which is very comfortable to lay down on but not so much to sit down on ( a couch would have done a big difference in my opinion).
The rooms were good but to be honest I expected much more, there was only one phone in the bedroom, which was a nuisance especially if my son was asleep in the bedroom and we wanted to order room service or call for house keeping.
The bathrooms were good as well with a bath separate from a shower, but again we were disappointed that the toilets did not have a bidet or a sprinkler as most hotels in Thailand that I've been to have.
Some areas of the exterior looked very tired and worn and not what you would expect from a 5 star resort, the hotel grounds were very dark at night as well.
The hotel food wasn't very consistent and would sometimes be disappointing, the breakfast buffet was good but not as good as other Sofitel hotels that I've been to, but on the other hand none of them were as busy as this hotel, so I guess quality had to suffer a bit, but you would still find everything you want and it was always good ( don't miss the pan au chocolate and doughnuts).
Room service was not that good and was disappointed by the pizza we ordered on one night. Walked in to the Thai restaurant, checked the menu and walked right out, but the good news is that there are many authentic Thai restaurants close by, either a 15 minute walk away or a 3 minute tuktuk ride for the good places (check out my other reviews).
The pool area was really good but it could sometimes get a bit difficult to find a good spot to sit as many guests come and put their stuff on chairs and leave.
The beach isn't great, but I understand it is situated on a national reserve and the law forbids the hotel altering it in any way, but the good news is that good beaches are not far away.
The hotel had an activity board that was updated every day which was very nice.
They had a very good kids zone and baby sitter services (but we didn't try them out) all in all the hotel was very children friendly, and this for me would be the main reason to come back.
And I believe twice a week they have BBQ night with a live show, which is very interesting.
So my final conclusion is that the Sofitel was very good, with some room for improvement, and unfortunately you don't really get the magnifique experience that they promise.
place: Sofitel Krabi Phokeethra Golf & Spa Resort

title: Best mall in Bahrain
text:
Bahrain city center is basically the best mall in Bahrain, lots of shops, nice atmosphere and great eating options.
The cinema is good but with room for improvement.
The parking lay out is so bad that it is funny, seems like it was designed by a clown on LSD, but other than that this is my favorite mall in Bahrain.
Word of caution though, it can get quite busy and unbearable during the weekends and public holidays.

title: Excellent food, terrible service
text:
For one of the best if not the best food in Bahrain come to Cocos.
I've been coming to cocos for about 10 years now and they have consistently provided exceptionally good food, the menu hasn't changed much if at all in the last 10 years but I guess "if it ain't broke why fix it?", so why the low rating?
The service is terrible, one of the worst I've experienced in Bahrain.
Not only is it very slow, and when I say slow I mean SLOW (you can wait for 45-60 minutes to get your order) but the staff are quite rude at times.
It also gets very busy ( due to the exceptionally good food) , you could wait for 30 minutes or more just to get a table during peak times, so if you come here make sure you have at least a couple of hours, a couple of times I had to leave after waiting for about an hour for my food because I just couldn't wait any more.
Some recommendations: to start the chicken broccoli soup, chicken mushroom soup and cocos salad (even though the portion has significantly reduced) are great, for mains I would suggest the Lahina, Swahili or spicy chicken, for dessert the caramel date cake is great and for drinks the peach ice tea is a favorite, but honestly you can't go wrong with whatever you choose.
I would also suggest you go at off peak times, peak times are obviously lunch and dinner times and especially the weekends, the best time for me would be a late lunch, as it is much quieter.
So for excellent food at a reasonable price but terrible service go to Cocos.

title: Not Bad
text:
I dined in the Holiday Inn branch, the set up is a bit awkward, with an open seating area next to the entrance of the hotel, there is a small semi private non smoking seating area with about 3-4 tables, 2 of which are 2 seaters.
The food was good and the complimentary green is a nice touch.
Had the California maki, spicy volcano maki and a vegetarian noodles.
The California Maki was good but wasn't packed neatly and tightly as Makis usually are, the volcano wasn't bad, and the noodles was average.
All in all nice food but with room for improvement, not much of an ambiance, and wouldn't travel far to eat here, basically a nice place to dine if you are next to it and in the mood for Japanese.

title: Good tapas but really over prices
text: Some good Tapas but was very expensive for what was offered, they had 3 staff working when I went, 1 guy was very friendly and nice, but the other 2 were quite rude and acted like they were forced to work there. Not a terrible experience but wouldn't go back.

title: Beautiful !
text:
The best advice you could get is to buy your tickets online, unfortunately for me this didn't work, I tried for 2 days to buy the tickets online but they wouldn't accept the payment, I was using a Visa.
Finally decided to do it the old fashioned way and hit the queue.
The queue took me 1 hour, and just a quick tip, you can usually catch a free wifi while in the queue.
Arrived to the front of the queue at 1230 and got a ticket for 1330 at the earliest, but heard some people in the next window who wanted to go up the towers and the earliest visit time they got was 1830.
The audio guide is highly recommended.
Also be advised that if you have children under the age of 6, you won't be allowed in the towers.
Another tip is to take in some water with you, as we spent about 2 hours admiring the basilica without even realising it, and no drinks or snacks were sold inside.
The Basilica is beautiful from the outside and the inside, only built by the fees they receive from entrance fees and private donations.
All in all a must if you are in Barcelona, and hopefully you will be more successful purchasing your tickets online.

title: Interesting park
text:
Quite an interesting and different park, interesting works of art by Gaudi, but don't expect too much.
The park isn't as big as you would think and not as much to see as you would think.
As everyone suggested, you SHOULD get your tickets online.
Once in, there is another long queue to enter Gaudi's house, and next to the house they have a cafeteria with not so good over priced snacks and drinks, and public restrooms.
A word of caution: getting to the park requires ALOT of uphill walking, so be prepared, and the closest metro is about a 15 minute walk.
Overall I think it deserves a 3.5 star rating.

title: keep on walking
text: Came here before reading the reviews, and the reviews are mostly true. Do not come here for the food or the service, if you just want a drink and do some people watching its fine, but don't expect friendly service. This is actually the first time I see waiters smoking while still on duty.

title: Very good vegetarian food but not moroccan
text:
Decided to come here since my wife is both a vegetarian and a moroccan. Came here with my wife, our 7 month old son and my wife's brother, the place is very easy to miss even if you are specifically looking for it.
The place is very small but went there at around 4 in the afternoon so it was pretty quiet.
They provided us with an english menu which was very helpful, most of the food comes in like a pie form with a vegetarian filling, kind of like the moroccan Pastillas but not quite ( since they use bread instead of the pastillas pastry). Us 2 guys took the four seasons since this was the most appealing for a none vegetarian and my wife took the tofu, the tofu was quite good but the four seasons was really really good and highly recommended, the 3 of us agreed that the four seasons was the way to go and that the only thing moroccan about this place was the music.
Be advised that the "pies" are quite filling, so if you don't have a big appetite you might want to share, we ended up taking half a pie back home with us ( they wrap it up in aluminium foil for you).
For 3 "pies" and a bottle of water, we paid 29 euros.

title: Great Gelato
text:
Came here after a late lunch, the place wasn't busy (only 1 customer ahead of us), the staff were very friendly and spoke good english.
The offered to let us taste whatever we wanted before we made our decision.
We had the Argentinian chocolate, the Cafe and the Pistachio , all were very good.

title: Nice and touristy
text:
Every major city has one and for Barcelona it is Las Ramblas, pretty crowded on any day of the week, but its a must when in Barcelona, had no problems with pick pockets but in a place like this it is advisable to keep an eye on your belongings and to use your common sense (such as not keeping your bulky wallet or shiny new iPhone on your back pocket), the street is filled with vendors, cafes, restaurants, street performers and souvenir stalls, just keep in mind that everything is more expensive, not as authentic and not as good as else where in Barcelona, which is to be expected.
Enjoy.

title: Interesting and recommended if close by
text:
From what I understand, this market is over 100 years old, but not quite sure about its history, we passed by it and decided to check it out, interesting sights and smells and if you are next to it then you should check it out, but don't come out of your way for it.
The only thing I bought here was some passion fruit juice which turned out to be very good.
It gets quite crowded but isn't stuffy, didn't have much trouble walking around though, even with a baby stroller at hand.
The only time you may have trouble moving around is when us tourists stop to take pictures.

title: Amazing location but...
text:
Came here for a weekend with my wife, initial reaction was "wooow" but unfortunately it wasn't all good.

Pros: Great location, amazing beaches, great and clean rooms with a beautiful view and an overall comfortable stay.

Cons: Everything was over priced, A decent meal for two where you would expect to pay about 50 euros at any of the top restaurants in Muscat would cost you about double that.
a simple vegetarian sandwich (which was just a salad between 2 slices of bread) would cost you about 16 euros.
swimming trunks at the gift shop would set you back about 100 euros!
Service was absolutely terrible! I don't think they could have provided a slower service if they tried! Sat down for breakfast (at the very dissapointing breakfast buffet) and ordered an egg white omelette as they do not have an egg station, and by the time we left about 35 minutes later, the omelette still hadn't arrived.
Ordered a plate of fries and a couple of drinks at 1 of the private beaches, and I kid you not, it took about 40 minutes to arrive!
So overall it is a nice hotel in an amazing location that has the potential of being mind blowing!

title: Great food and service
text:
Came here on the weekend, the place was packed. I meant to make my reservation for 19:00 but when we got there they told us my reservation was for 18:30 and that I was late. When I checked it turned out that they were right. Anyway the staff were really good and offered us a table anyway, but said there will be a time limit of 01:50 hrs, but we were fine with that.
The steaks were really good, only exceeded by the service.
Only issue I had was that the food arrived cold, but we were too hungry at that point to send them back.
Would definitely come back.

title: Best Burgers in London
text: I really love this place in westfields mall, I sometimes take an hour train ride just to eat here. Great burgers and great shakes as well. Excellent service. Highly recommended.

title: Honestly just average
text:
My wife and me stayed here for a couple of nights on our way back from Siem Reap. We asked for the hotel to pick us up and they were there waiting for us as we exited.
Only hotel in Cambodia so far that did not offer refreshments or cold towels in the car, but this was offered upon check in
On check in the manager was close by working on the computer, he glanced at us and then continued working, no “welcome” or “hello”, which I found very strange, especially for Cambodia and even more so for a boutique hotel.
We got to our junior sweet and the room was quite nice and clean, bigger than the other hotels I stayed in, but looked a bit tired.
The breakfast was limited, but I thought the little they did, they did well.
I asked for an iron on my last night, and I must have gotten the smallest iron board in Cambodia with an iron that had a hilariously short cord, was very frustrating to try an iron with that thing.
The service was so and so, and the staff were not as competent as I’ve seen in other places.
I checked out around 8pm, so my room was booked for an extra day, I explained this a couple of times to the front desk, but they still seemed confused when I told them I'm checking out that night.
I asked for the hotel car to the airport but as I checked out I was told they got me a taxi, it wasn't a big deal but it was just another example of the so and so service.
Anyway the check out took about 10-15 minutes I think; because of all the confusion.
All in all it was an all right place to stay, but I wouldn't come back, not because anything was particularly disappointing, but because I’ve seen much better in PP.
To be fair I usually paid more, so maybe in the end of the day it’s just a case of you get what you pay for.

title: Beautiful
text:
We came here at around 5am for the sunrise, but unfortunately it was a cloudy morning and we couldn't see it. Even at that time of the day the place is filled with tourists and shop owners trying to get you to have breakfast at their stall (they later get replaced with scarf, fridge magnet and travel book sellers).
Never the less its an absolute must and jaw dropping, especially after you wrap your head around the fact that this was the center of the worlds largest city until the industrial revolution! Home to approximately 1 million people, and it was all built around 1,000 years ago!
The temple itself is a wonder and I think many people forget the fact that the moat surrounding the temple was also man made around 1,000 years ago, which I find to be another wonder all on its own.
My suggestion is to watch a documentary of the temple before visiting (national geographic have a great one) and many hotels did have DVDs with these documentaries in the rooms, well at least mine did and it was very helpful.

title: Not impressed
text:
Came here with my wife one afternoon for lunch based on the reviews I read on TripAdvisor.
At the time we visited we were the only ones there, we decided to sit upstairs.
The staff were friendly enough and gave us our menus.
My wife had the vegetarian noodles and I had the beef noodles. 20 minutes later her food arrived and the waitress apologised for the delay, 10 minutes after that my food arrived, the food wasn't good at all unfortunately and we left our plates barely touched.
We left with empty stomaches, so far this was the only place in Cambodia where the food was less than satisfying and where the food took almost 30 minutes to get to our table.
I've noticed most reviews talk about the burgers or the pizzas, so maybe those are good.
But wouldn't recommend this place, so far the only place I wouldn't recommend in Cambodia.

title: Disappointing food
text:
We came here one evening for dinner, but it was a real disappointment and we left with empty stomachs.
My wife is a vegetarian and they had very few options and they were all cold food, nothing to fill the stomach after a long day of temple hoping.
The food is basically a tapas kind of thing, with a few main courses available, I ordered the amok fish but 2 minutes later they came back to me and said it wasn't available.
I ended up ordering to starters, 1 was good the other wasn't edible.
Siem Reap is filled with amazing restaurants, unfortunately this isn't one of them.

title: Great place, Great food.
text:
Came here for lunch with my wife a couple of days ago based on the reviews on TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed.
Forget about the good cause, this place some of the best food we had while in Cambodia, the staff are friendly and a couple of host go around each table welcoming you and chitchatting to you before moving on to the next table.
My wife had the Vegetarian lasagna and I had Prawns, and for dessert we had the caramelised bananas. Each dish was better than the other!
Highly recommended, if not for the good cause then for the great food!
Highly recommended.

title: great atmosphere and even better food
text: Me and my wife came here for lunch a couple of days ago. The place looks very beautiful and the food did not disappoint! The highlight of the meal was the dessert, we had the sticky rice with mango which is highly recommended. If you are in Siem Reap than you should pass by for a bite.

title: A must do!
text:
We came here a few days ago (me and my wife). We were picked up from the hotel and as we arrived we were welcomed and given a safety brief by the most unpleasant cambodian, it seemed he really had an attitude problem (don't worry it gets better, it really does deserve 5 stars), then we were taken out for a test ride, but as soon as we got out of the garage, it started pouring down! so we went back and cancelled the ride.
Came back a few days later and met a delightful host, who went over the safety brief once again but this time very briefly because I went through it all before, then we did the short test drive and came back to pay for the tour and go off. I took the 2 hour tour and the only disappointment I had was that I didn't do a longer one.
My guide Mr. Koy was fantastic, he even took me to his home to see how the real cambodians live, and I think this was the highlight of the tour.
This was the only activity that I say that it is a must in Siem Reap and that you should not avoid it at any cost!
And when you go you should ask for Mr. Koy, he will make sure you wont get disappointed.
Make sure you take lots of candy for the kids you meet in the villages.
I went just after it rained so the roads were not dusty, so i'm guessing it is best to go after the rains.
place: Siem Reap Quad Bike Adventure ATV Tours

title: Great food
text:
We were really looking forward to eating at friends after we read the reviews on TA. We called them last night to make a reservation but they were fully booked so we decided to just walk in and try our luck. We go there and we were seated immediately but the place as indeed packed.
The food was very good and atmosphere as good as well. I would recommend this place but I personally enjoyed my meal more at their sister restaurant Romdeng.
My advice is that you MUST go to both while in PP and always leave room for dessert!

title: Best in Phnom Penh
text:
We came here for lunch after Friends was closed for training, but it wasn't a big change of plans as we were planing to come here for dinner anyway.
This was some of the best food we had in Cambodia and definitely the best in PP. This was the first place we ate in in Cambodia when we arrived and the last just before leaving. The Amok fish is highly recommended, the pickled lime soda was a new experience, it was salty and sweet at the same time, but it was part of the weekly specials. My 1 piece of advice, ALWAYS ALWAYS leave room for dessert, the banana dumplings were amazing, but also part of the weekly specials.
I think this restaurant should move to number one.

title: Great hotel, excellent staff.
text:
We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights checking out on 19/05/2013. I contacted them via email to give them my flight details so that they could pick me up, but unfortunately I got no response, so i tried another 2 times but still nothing, so I finally decided to call them, someone answered and barely heard them because of the very noisy background (sounded like they were in a market) but I managed to get my details across. And that is where the disappointments ended.
Ms. Bunna apologising for the late response and confirming my pick up sent me an email.
I was met in the airport by the most delightful cambodians you will ever meet Mr. Alex and our driver Mr. Ley.
A very warm welcome later and a quick explanation of the city and we were in the hotel.
The Privilege Floor is located on the 4th floor of the Borei Angkor hotel.
As other users said the hotel premises isn't impressive but the Privilege Floor makes up for this in other areas.
We were met by Ms. Bunna who once again apologised for the email issue, then explained the hotel facilities which include free mini bar, free wifi, free laundry,mobile phone, breakfast, cocktails, and most importantly a driver 24/7.
The Premier Double Room was of good size, with a small balcony and a lovely bathroom where the shower and the beautiful bathtub are separate.
You can choose to have breakfast at the lobby (wider selection but nothing special) or at the Damnak lounge, which is on the 4th floor (small selection but had everything I needed). The biggest issue I had with the breakfast that the bread was always stale, but I would suggest to have the breakfast here if for no other reason but to meet Mr. Say, the nicest guy you will ever meet, and who would always try to make your stay more pleasurable (he made sure we had a fresh cold fruit platter waiting for us in our room whenever we got back from the temples).
The pool area was very good and we used it once. My wife took the massage in the spa and that was very good as well.
The evening cocktails served between 1700-1900 were a great way to spend some time and have some good snacks before dinner and as an added bonus you get to meet the wonderful Mr. Sokman who even prepared some great vegetarian snacks for my wife, he was just a delight and worth going to the Damnak lounge to just meet him if for nothing else.
I stayed in quite a few hotels in Cambodia and even more around the world, but the privilege floor has by far the best staff i've ever met and so I think they deserve a special mention.
I think Cambodia’s real treasure is its people and The Privilege Floor has the crème de la crème.
So thank you Mr. Alex and Ms. Bunna for making our stay amazing and making sure everywhere we went would cater to our special needs even though we didn't ask (My wife is a vegetarian, I don't eat pork , ...etc) , thank you Mr. Say for making our breakfast that more pleasant and for giving us that hand written list of some important Cambodian words translated to english, Thank you Mr. Sokman for making our evening cocktails that more fun and making us laugh all the time and finally thank you Mr. Ley for not only being our driver but also being our tour guide for 4 great days.
I enjoyed my stay here so much so that it forced me from just reading reviews for years to writing my first one.
place: THE PRIVILEGE FLOOR by Borei Angkor

title: Great hotel
text:
Stayed in the Sofitel for a couple of nights only. I asked them to pick me up from the hotel and they were waiting for me as I exited. Cold water and Cold towels were waiting for us when we entered the car. We asked for the BMW, which was good and comfortable but was difficult to accommodate our luggage (we had 2 big bags, they were empty but big) so on the way back we took the Hyundai H1.
The staff welcomed us with cold lemongrass tea and cold towels as we arrived. We took the luxury King room and upon check in they asked us if we would like the club millesime benefits, which included breakfast and wifi for $75 and we agreed.
On the second day we booked a tuktuk from the hotel for half a day to take us to all the sites for about $17 and that was good, but I think if you get someone from outside it would be cheaper.
We had dinner at the Italian restaurant, the food was good but nothing special, except for the tiramisu, which I thought, was absolutely amazing, the best I’ve ever had.
The breakfast buffet was hands down the best we have ever had and I have had breakfast in hotels from LA to Manila and many places in between, and the only competition was a buffet I had in a hotel in Dubai.
The pool area was very good and they provide you with a complimentary cold bottle of water.
Staffs were always very helpful as well.
I would definitely stay here in my next time in Phnom Penh and I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone I know.

title: Just alright
text: Nothing special, just some old artefacts which you are not allowed to take pictures of, you can finish the museum in about 10 minutes, and since we saw much more in Siem Reaps temples, this was a waste of time and money.

title: Nothing special
text: Very small temple, you can barely see the silver since it is all covered up with carpet, unfortunately the royal palace was closed when we went for the kings birthday, so we had no choice but to see the pagoda.

title: Excellent food and wonderful service
text:
Me and wife came here a couple of nights ago based on TA reviews and we were not disappointed.
Our hotel advised them about 10 minutes before we arrived that my wife was a vegetarian and by the time we got there they had a whole menu for her!
We were greeted by whom I think was the owner (lovely french lady), and she explained the menu and the hotel theme for us, then she got the chef (very friendly french guy) who came out and explained the special veg. menu for my wife.
Out of the 5 courses we had 3 were out of this world and 2 were very good.
The seating area is very good as well, we sat inside but I think next time we would prefer to sit upstairs.
Highly recommended,please don't miss out.
